xxl.core.io
Class LinkedContainerBlocks

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.LinkedContainerBlocks

public class LinkedContainerBlocks
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains some static methods which can be used to store objects in a chain of linked Block-objects inside a container. This is useful, because the size of objects inside a container is usually bounded by the page size.

Each Block is supposed to have a block header. The first 5 bytes of each Block are reserved for storing internally used data. The next bytes are used to store a pointer to the next Block (size is determined by the objectIdConverter of the Container).

So, each method gets the page size and the size of the header. The size of the header has to be larger than or equal to 5+size of the identifyers of the Container.

Method Summary
static Cursor readObjectsFromLinkedContainerBlocks(Container container, Converter converter, java.lang.Object pageId, int blockSize, int headerSize)
          Reads and returns objects from a container starting at the given page identifyer.
static void removeLinkedBlocks(Container container, java.lang.Object pageId, boolean removeFirstBlock)
          Removes a chain of linked blocks from the container.

Method Detail

readObjectsFromLinkedContainerBlocks

public static Cursor readObjectsFromLinkedContainerBlocks(Container container,
                                                          Converter converter,
                                                          java.lang.Object pageId,
                                                          int blockSize,
                                                          int headerSize)
Reads and returns objects from a container starting at the given page identifyer.

Parameters:
container - The container used to store the data.
converter - The converter used to deserialize the objects of the iteration.
pageId - First Identifyer of the Container where the chain of blocks starts.
blockSize - The size of each Block inside the Container.
headerSize - The size of the header inside each Block.
Returns:
The cursor containing the objects from the chained Blocks.

removeLinkedBlocks

public static void removeLinkedBlocks(Container container,
                                      java.lang.Object pageId,
                                      boolean removeFirstBlock)
Removes a chain of linked blocks from the container.

Parameters:
container - The container used to store the data.
pageId - The page identifyer of the first Block to be removed. This does not have to be the first Block of the chain.
removeFirstBlock - True iff the Block with the identifyer pageId also has to be removed.

writeObjectsToLinkedContainerBlocks

public static java.lang.Object writeObjectsToLinkedContainerBlocks(Container container,
                                                                   Converter converter,
                                                                   java.util.Iterator it,
                                                                   java.lang.Object firstPageId,
                                                                   int blockSize,
                                                                   int headerSize)
Writes the objects from the Iterator into the Container. If multiple Blocks are used, they are linked.

Parameters:
container - The container used to store the data.
converter - The converter used to serialize the objects of the iteration.
it - The objects to be stored.
firstPageId - First Identifyer of the Container which has to be overwritten. If a chain of Blocks is detected, then all of them are overwritten or removed. If firstPageId is null then only a new chain is written.
blockSize - The size of each Block inside the Container.
headerSize - The size of the header inside each Block.
Returns:
The page identifyer used for the first Block inside the Container.
